scl10.uk.ac.aber.users.manipulators

Class ImageManipulatorTest

  • java.lang.Object
    • scl10.uk.ac.aber.users.manipulators.ImageManipulatorTest

  • public class ImageManipulatorTest
extends java.lang.Object
    A class used for testing the functionality the ImageManipulator class.
    Author:
    Scott Lockett

      • assertImages

        private void assertImages(@NonNull
                          java.awt.image.BufferedImage image1,
                          @NonNull
                          java.awt.image.BufferedImage image2)
        Method used for asserting that each pixel within two images are within a certain range of +/- 25 in each channel. If not then the assertion will fail.
        Parameters:
        image1 - The first image to asserted as being the same as the second image
        image2 - The second image to asserted as being the same as the first image

      • testAveragedColouredImageFromImage

        public void testAveragedColouredImageFromImage()
        This test ensures that given a half red and half yellow image (primary colours) a average colour is taken of the two (orange) and will be returned the original images size. This test makes use of the Sikuli library as a proof of concept as to its use within JUnit testing. Sikuli was chosen as an improved method of image assertion than that of my assertImages(BufferedImage, BufferedImage) method. This is because Sikuli uses OpenCV's pattern matching methods and fuzzy logical in order to find images within a screen as opposed to using a very large delta which was my original way.

      • testConvertingColoredImageToGreyScaleImage

        public void testConvertingColoredImageToGreyScaleImage()
        This test ensures that given a half red and half yellow image (primary colours) a average colour is taken of the two (orange) and will be returned the original images size. This test makes use of the Sikuli library as a proof of concept as to its use within JUnit testing. Sikuli was chosen as an improved method of image assertion than that of my assertImages(BufferedImage, BufferedImage) method. This is because Sikuli uses OpenCV's pattern matching methods and fuzzy logical in order to find images within a screen as opposed to using a very large delta which was my original way.

      • testFlippingImage

        public void testFlippingImage()
        Tests that an image can be correctly flipped/ reflected.

        public void testImageDownsampling()
        Test the image manipulator's downsampling method.
